channel.title: Infodia problem

item.title: Infodia problem
item.dc:creator: @mod_xtomx mod xtomx
item.description:
@mod_xtomx wrote:

Hello everybody, I have a login message to display for my new users, but I had to make a public void… which is here

} public void infodia(String text, String text2, String text3, String text4, String title){ sendFrame126(title, 6180); sendFrame126(text, 6181); sendFrame126(text2, 6182); sendFrame126(text3, 6183); sendFrame126(text4, 6184); sendFrame164(6179); }

And then here is the starter code

} if(starter == 0){ starter = 1; showInterface(3559); apset = true; addItem(392, 100); addItem(556, 100); addItem(557, 100); addItem(558, 100); addItem(555, 100); addItem(554, 100); addItem(562, 100); addItem(1323, 1); addItem(1725, 1); addItem(995, 2000000); addItem(3105, 1); addItem(7458, 1); infodia("Welcome to Runestrike", "You can earn money by thieving and crafting", "You can ask things to players and moderators ", "Thanks for playing Runestrike and have fun"," Game Guide"); }

And what this is creating is when new users register, the interface (3559) starts then the infodia with my text, makes the interface exit out, I tried adding

showInterface(3559); apset = true;
To the end, after the infodia but then the text won’t display… is there some way to have both of these display at the same time? If not there would be no use in that new user message.

Read full topic
